multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a very itchy rash on my upper back.
How long have you had this rash?
I've had the rash for 1 year.
Has the rash changed in appearance or size since you first noticed it?
Yes, the rash has slightly darkened in color.
Do you have any known allergies or have you started using any new products such as soaps, detergents, or lotions before the rash appeared?
No, I don't have any known allergies and I haven't started using any new products before the rash appeared.
Does the rash appear anywhere else on your body or is it localized to your upper back?
The rash is localized only to my upper back.
Are there any scales, blisters, or thickened areas within the rash?
No, there are no scales, blisters, or thickened areas within the rash.
Does anyone in your family have a history of skin conditions or similar symptoms?
No, there is no relevant family history of skin conditions or similar symptoms.
Has the rash been treated with any medications or creams? If so, what were they and was there any improvement?
I have not taken any medications or used any creams for the rash.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Urticaria.
